variables.input:
timeseries sum=sum(cloud.gcp.serviceruntime_googleapis_com.api.request_count), by:{ gcp.project.id }
| fields gcp.project.id, request_count=arraySum(sum)
| sort request_count desc
| fields gcp.project.id

1.title: Request count (sum)
1.query:
timeseries sum=sum(cloud.gcp.serviceruntime_googleapis_com.api.request_count), by: { service }, filter:in(gcp.project.id, $gcp_project_id)
| filter service != ""
| fields service, request_count=arraySum(sum)
| sort request_count desc
| limit toLong($top)

32.title: Request count (sum)
32.query:
timeseries request_count=sum(cloud.gcp.serviceruntime_googleapis_com.api.request_count), by: { response_code, method }, filter:in(gcp.project.id, $gcp_project_id)
| filter startsWith(response_code, "4")
| sort arraySum(request_count) desc

33.title: Request count (sum)
33.query:
timeseries sum=sum(cloud.gcp.serviceruntime_googleapis_com.api.request_count), by: { method,response_code }, filter:in(gcp.project.id, $gcp_project_id)
| filter startsWith(response_code, "4")
| fields `response_code|method`=concat(response_code," | ",method), request_count=arraySum(sum)
| sort request_count desc
| limit toLong($top)

35.title: Request count (sum)
35.query:
timeseries request_count=sum(cloud.gcp.serviceruntime_googleapis_com.api.request_count), by: { response_code,method }, filter:in(gcp.project.id, $gcp_project_id)
| filter startsWith(response_code, "5")
| sort arraySum(request_count) desc

36.title: Request count (sum)
36.query:
timeseries sum=sum(cloud.gcp.serviceruntime_googleapis_com.api.request_count), by: { method,response_code }, filter:in(gcp.project.id, $gcp_project_id)
| filter startsWith(response_code, "5")
| fields `response_code|method`=concat(response_code," | ",method), request_count=arraySum(sum)
| sort request_count desc
| limit toLong($top)

41.content:
Google Cloud APIs are programmatic interfaces.

GCP metrics are filtered by `gcp_project_id`, splitted by some dimension(s) and aggregated by 
- `sum` = sum of period and the other dimensions (example `count`), or
- `avg` = average over the period and over the other dimensions (example `latency`).
